editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Scholars of Merton College.

msDesc.head: AIDS TO BIBLICAL STUDY ; S. XV med.

msItem.title: PETRUS AUREOLI OFM, Compendium Litteralis Sensus Totius Scripturae
msItem.rubric: Incipit compendium litteralis sensus tocius diuine scripture editum a fratre P. Aureoli ordinis fratrum minorum et ponitur primo commendacio sacre scripture in generali
msItem.finalRubric: libro moralitatis exponens illud Iob ... (f. 6v) de quibus dictum est. Explicit commendacio sacre scripture. (f. 20) Incipit compendium litteralis sensus tocius diuine scripture. Considerandum est quod scriptura potest diuidi in 8 partes principales ... gratia D. n. I. C. cum omnibus uobis amen. Explicit compendium litteralis sensus tocius diuine scripture ..
msItem.note: ed. P. Seeboeck (Quaracchi, 1896); Glorieux,Théol. 351h; Stegmüller, Bibl. 6422.

msItem.title: Principium Biblicum
msItem.incipit: Omnem hominem primo generaliter ecclesiasticum et religiosum secundo specialiter prelatum
msItem.explicit: ad istum paradisum leticie ualeamus peruenire quod nobis concedat qui ..
msItem.note: Stegmüller, Bibl. 10197, citing only the copy in MS 201, art. 5.

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: Sermones
msItem.rubric: Sermo beati Augustini de legendo scripturam sacram
msItem.incipit: Scriptum est f. k. quod Moyses posuit in tabernaculo labrum eneum
msItem.finalRubric: Sermo 30 de penitencia. Admoneo f. in conspectu Dei timori uestro timorem meum .... Sermo 31 de Ieiunio et oratione. Aduersus demonum nequiciam nobis Dominus arma ostendit .... Sermo de cogitacionibus 32. Primum quidem cogitacionibus malis repugnandum est .... Sermo de filio prodego Luc. 15. Pax uobis d. qui optimam partem elegistis .... Sermo de oratione et eius perseuerancia 34. Fratres mei et leticia cordis mei tempus est ut reuertar ad eum .... Expliciunt sermones ad fratres habitantes in heremo per beatum Augustinum editi

msItem.author: Ps.-AUGUSTINE (NICETAS)
msItem.title: De Psalmodiae Bono
msItem.rubric: Sermo beati Augustini de utilitate psalmorum
msItem.finalRubric: s. amen. Explicit sermo beati Augustini ualde deuotus de utilitate psalmorum

msItem.title: Repertorium Vocabulorum Bibliae
msItem.incipit: Licet nonnulli cuncta uocabula biblie simplicibus ignota lucidius exponenda diligenter laborauerunt
msItem.explicit: ; Abba secundum Papiam Syrum nomen est ..
msItem.finalRubric: Zizannia penultima corda grecum est .... Explicit repertorium biblie
msItem.note: unpr.; also in Eton Coll. 4, Graz, Universitätsbibl. 322; Hereford Cath. O. V. 2; BL Harl. 2270, Royal 8 E. vii; Lambeth 162; Bodl. Libr., Bodl. 863, Laud. misc. 30; MS 234 below, art. 2. Stegmüller, Bibl. 1159. Ascr. by Bale (Index, p. 25) to Alexander Nequam, and seen by him at Oriel College and London, St Peter

msItem.author: WILLIAM NORTON OFM
msItem.title: Index to NICHOLAS DE LYRA, biblical commentaries
msItem.note: Preceded by a list of quaestiones, ff. 167v-70, ‘Vtrum apocalipsis liber conuenienter ponitur ultimus in canone cum tamen scriberetur ante euuangelium Iohannis in prologo expositionis super euuangeliumVtrum liris [scil. iris] sit signum federis Gen. 9. Expliciunt questiones fratris Nicholai de Lira super Bibliam.’ The same list is in Eton Coll. 108, ff. 186-7 (MMBL 2. 722). ‘Tabula super doctorem de Lyra super uetus et nouum testamentum. Abacuck prophetauit destruccionem Caldeorum Zorobabel erat de tribu regia. Explicit tabula super doctorem de Lira compilata per fratrem Willelmum Norton de sacro ordine fratrum minorum in conuentu Couentrensi anno Domini millesimo CCCC tercio.’ unpr.; Stegmüller, Bibl. 3000; Sharpe, Handlist , p. 795; one of seven copies.

msItem.title: Expositio Litteralis Psalterii
msItem.incipit: Ad consolacionem fidelium eorum maxime qui expositio sancte Paule [sic] amplectuntur scripturarum historicum
msItem.explicit: Hebreos consueuit uocari liber iste soliloquium Messie et sic finis restat psalterii
msItem.note: Stegmüller, Bibl. 10195, apparently the unique copy.

physDesc.p: Structure: 289 leaves (iii + 286), 315 × 220 (230 × 150) mm., the edges retrimmed with loss of marginalia and spattered with red. ff. i-iii and 286 are of thick, stiff parchment. The outer col. of f. 18 excised. Frame-ruled with crayon in 2 cols; written in c. 52 lines. Collation: a bifolium, a singleton, 16, 212(+ 1 after 12), 3-2412, a bifolium, a singleton; catchwords. Quire 2 is bound out of order (see below). Binding: Standard Merton s. xvii, repaired and rebacked by Maltby, 1953; sewn on six bands; formerly chained from the usual position. On a previous binding were two straps from the front board to clasps at the rear. At the foot of the front board, towards the foredge, was a brass chain-staple. The outermost leaves were pastedowns in an earlier binding.

supportDesc.collation: a bifolium, a singleton, 16, 212(+ 1 after 12), 3-2412, a bifolium, a singleton; catchwords. Quire 2 is bound out of order (see below).

handDesc.handNote: Written in a single proficient secretary hand. At the foot of f. 7 is ‘pro scriptura quat’ xv d.’ At the foot of f. 167v, in tiny letters, ‘pro scriptura iii. s. vii d.’ At the foot of f. 283v is pencilled ‘of gret let’ xl lett’ / of paraf ii s qa’’. Correction marks. Marginal annotation in contemporary hands.

decoDesc.decoNote: Blue initials flourished in red; red or blue paraphs; red underlining of lemmata.

binding.p: Standard Merton s. xvii, repaired and rebacked by Maltby, 1953; sewn on six bands; formerly chained from the usual position. On a previous binding were two straps from the front board to clasps at the rear. At the foot of the front board, towards the foredge, was a brass chain-staple. The outermost leaves were pastedowns in an earlier binding.

history.provenance: At the foot of f. iiiv‘Liber Willelmi Romsey propriis sumptibus scriptus’. Romsey or Rumsey (BRUO 1606-7) was fellowc.1449 until at least 1463, d. 1512; he also gave MSS 47 and 247. The College received this book on 25 May 1493, chaining it in the library on 2 Aug. 1494 (Registrum, pp. 173, 184). On f. i is ‘2’, written early but probably after rather than before the leaf was a pastedown. Inside the front board is a sheet of paper with contents and ‘F. 7, 13’ (canc.), s. xvii, and the College bookplate. ‘B. 2. 2’ is pencilled near the head. At the head of f. 1 is the James no. ‘208’, s. xvii in. ‘13’ is inked on the foredge.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.
